instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned L8570, not waking up after closing the display lid
threads.message:
Hi,

trying to repair this board for my customer. everything else seems fine on this board.
After closing the display, Backlight doesnt show up but lcd is working.
L8570 is burned, dont know which part on other boards i could use to replace it. have a few <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> faulty boards for parts. 

Hope you can help me

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> burned L8570, not waking up after closing the display lid
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

L8570 usually gets burnt because of short in the flex inside LCD assembly.
You should try another one.
What is actual <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> voltage?
